This looks interesting, can you expand on what this does? I am assuming it just takes a snapshot of the site once its updated?

I have it set to up with a GitHub action when i make a push to my staging branch on GitHub, action pushes changes to the staging sandbox we have set up. Then Percy grabs a snapshot of the production environment then a snapshot of the staging URL.  It compares the two and identifies any visual differences. You log in to Percy and approve or disapprove any changes. Eventually, will have this set up with a pull request where request will not complete until you get approval on percy
